instructions:
Cut cabbage into 6 or 8 wedges and secure outer leaves with a toothpick. Parboil in a covered pan for 25
to 30 minutes, then drain and place in a 2-quart buttered
casserole.
Melt 2 tbsp butter in a double boiler, add flour and stir till smooth. Slowly stir in milk and cook for about
3 minutes or until it shows thickening. Add salt, pepper, mustard, Worcestershire and cheese and stir until
melted. Pour cheese sauce over cabbage, dot with remaining butter, and sprinkle with crumbs. Bake in 375
F oven for about 15 minutes or until golden brown and bubbling around the edges.
ingredients: 1/2 inch slice Velveta cheese, cut in chunks
name: Baked Cabbage Au Gratin
